radiographic_examinations.findings: Lytic lesion in the left iliac crest with destruction and invasion into the adjacent muscles.
Two new lytic lesions in the ischium and three enlarged parailiacal and paraaortic lymph nodes.
Increased activity only in the specific locus of the pelvic lesion.
Multiple pulmonary nodules and a nodular lesion with a diameter of 12 mm in the left adrenal gland.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Wait-and-scan policy was continued due to extremely slow progression of the disease.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Intense activity in the area of the left adrenal gland and the left iliac crest.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: New lesions found in vertebrae 4 and 9 and irregular uptake in several ribs.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodular lesion with a diameter of 2 cm of the left adrenal gland.
Irregular destruction of the petrosal bone and the temporomandibular joint.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant increase in norepinephrine excretion noted in 2005.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Increased uptake in the right side of the neck and intense uptake in the area of the right adrenal and the liver.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Presence of three small cysts in the liver with a maximal diameter of 6 mm.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Demonstrated a vagal glomus tumor and a small carotid body tumor on the left.
Tumor with a diameter of 8 cm in direct relation with the bladder.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Development of recurrent tumor tissue and multiple peritoneal metastases identified.
